title: Economic Impact Analysis of Cycling Infrastructure: A Multi-City Study
abstract: This research provides a comprehensive economic analysis of cycling infrastructure investments across 8 cities of varying sizes and contexts. Using cost-benefit analysis framework incorporating direct construction costs, health benefits, emission reductions, and business impacts, we demonstrate consistently positive return on investment.

title: Valuing the Co-Benefits: Economic Assessment of Cycling's Environmental and Social Returns
abstract: This paper develops an expanded framework for economically valuing the full range of co-benefits generated by cycling infrastructure. We present methodologies for calculating the monetary value of noise reduction, air quality improvements, social cohesion, and other traditionally undervalued benefits.
